article.headline: Harvard 75, Maine 71
article.story: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. (AP) -- Brian Cusworth scored 20 points and Jim Goffredo added 19 points to lead Harvard past Maine 75-71 in the season opener for both teams on Saturday. Harvard trailed by seven early in the second half, but Cusworth scored nine straight for the Crimson to help them crawl back despite getting outrebounded 42-29. Cusworth's 3-point play with 11:56 remaining pulled Harvard to 47-46. Brad Unger tied it at 47 with a free throw a minute later. The teams traded baskets until Drew Housman's jumper put Harvard up for good 66-65 with 3:22 remaining. Housman finished with 15 points. After Maine's Junior Bernal missed two free throws, Evan Harris followed with a 3-point play to push Harvard's lead to 69-65. Harris finished with nine points, making 7-of-9 free throws. Philippe Tchekane-Bofia's basket made the score 73-71 in the closing seconds, but Housman sealed the win for Harvard with two free throws. Bernal scored 18 points on 6-of-9 shooting and Tchekane-Bofia added 17 points and 10 rebounds for Maine. After sitting out last year with a broken foot, Kevin Reed scored 12 for Maine before fouling out in the closing minutes.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
